Mr* Richard Hull
November 30, 195>0
Although all of us have been in agreement for a number of years
that regional meetings would help strengthen the organization and
pull in any new members, no one seems to \have gotten a regional meeting
started. As director of your region, why not try to have a meeting
in a central position in your region, or Work out a joint meeting with
one of your neighboring regions for February or March, This is a lax
period for national meetings generally and you should be able to pull
good attendance* Such a meeting would serve as a stimulus for getting
more people to come into the organisation and to attend the NAEB
Columbus meeting as well as laying the groundwork for a big attendance
at our fall meeting at Piloxi next year. If I can be of service to,
you in planning such a regional meeting, please call on me.
RAKB is our organisation. Let's put a lot into it during the '
significant twelve' months ahead. The success of the organization in,
your region depends largely upon you-and HAEB will be only as strong
as its individual regions make it. *
Yours for a good year*
Sincerely*
